results.description:
This is a group for parents  of biracial or African American children who strive to offer their children the best advantages in life.Sometimes, this results in our children not having many representations of themselves on a day to day basis. Parents of trans-racially adopted children are also welcome.


This group is to serve as a place for us parents to discuss ways to keep our children grounded and secure in their identity despite being part of a minority in their home and/or academic environment . Eventually, we will share events where the children will see others like themselves in a casual atmosphere i.e . arts activities( Alvin Ailey, Museum trips etc. ), Park picnics, sports, philanthropy  etc. Of course, sometimes , moms want to just unwind with a chat and a laugh and we'll have some of that too!


If you appreciate the idea behind J&J but not the hurdles then you should be right at home!

results.description:
The mission of New Jersey Screenwriters is to provide formal tools to established and aspiring screenwriters alike while also fostering a sense of community and mutual learning that engenders friendship, fellowship and the potential to create marketable products. This community provides opportunities for writers to acquire or hone a variety of skills, from character development, structure and formatting to pitching. Peer to peer feedback will be a routine aspect of each meeting along with career guidance from industry professionals. Affording opportunities to network both personally and professionally is a foundation of this organization. This is accomplished through the following types of monthly events: - Writing Workshops: We bring in industry professionals for hands-on sessions where you can learn new techniques and skills to improve your work. - Feedback Opportunities and Pitching Practice: You will have many opportunities to present in front of your peers in order to gain exposure and gather feedback. - Networking Events: Meet other writers, actors, directors, producers, and other industry professionals to explore and form new collaborations. - Film Screenings: We curate films based on the group's interest to stimulate and facilitate group discussion and learning. - Guest Speaker Series: We invite active industry professionals who will share their experiences, insights, and advice. The programming of this group and the nature of the support will grow and align with the needs of New Jersey Screenwriters (NJS) members.

results.description:
CCNYC is the local chapter of Conscious Capitalism, a national organization rooted in the principles of Conscious Capitalism as described by John Mackey and Raj Sisodia in their seminal book.

The commitment to create a Conscious Capitalism Chapter in one of the world’s global financial centers presents a unique opportunity. Those of us spearheading the effort have felt a great sense of responsibility to create an organization that not only reflects the character and commerce of this city, but also supports the tenets of Conscious Capitalism in a place that unquestionably has tremendous influence over the way capitalism is practiced in the world today. As we move forward, we want to acknowledge the special circumstances and enormous opportunities inherent in building a chapter so close to Wall Street. And so, we’ve come to the conclusion as a group that our chapter must be as inclusive as this city, and also as driven.

We believe Conscious Capitalism is a new paradigm for operating corporations; one that recognizes the power of capitalism to improve the human condition and create enduring value for all stakeholders. We invite anyone who is curious about these ideas and those who already embrace them to join us as we reach high and strive to create change in our society.
results.name: Conscious Capitalism NYC

results.description:
“A mystical approach to Judaism is…less dogmatic and more experimental. It doesn’t have a low ceiling, capping the mind and frustrating its desire to unify in love and awe with a vital, living universe. It is open minded, open souled. It says, ‘Try this. If you feel it as a living reality, we’re getting somewhere.’” 

Reb Zalman Schachter-Shalomi zt”l 

This is an incredibly exciting time to be Jewish! As the paradigms shift, it is becoming increasingly clear that much of Judaism is rapidly evolving into a community more attuned to the inner life and focused on awakening, that is, the expansion of consciousness. 

Uri! Uri! Awaken! Awaken! A Community of Spiritual Seekers (for Jews and Non-Jews), now emerging in Flatbush (Brooklyn), is a part of this exciting transition, and we invite you into our experimental boat! 

Come chant, dance, drum, and meditate with us! Grab an oar! 

But first, email us, so we can have a cup of tea together! 

May your Light increase! 

Stay blessed and be well.
results.name: Uri! Uri! Awaken! Awaken!

results.description:
Life in New York is fun but it does take a toll on us. We are always in a rush, always in transition. By the weekend or a day off, we are exhausted and don't even feel that accomplished. In all this vanity, we hardly spend any time with our friends, people we could open ours souls to. We almost never have time or possibility to sit down with a trusted friend and open up about our thoughts and feelings. We push it all down in a constant chase for New York life. No wonder, we get burned out, we loose touch with who we are. Then we make mistakes in our choices when it comes to careers and relationships. We get lost. 
So my dear Goddess we need to find time to create that safe place where we could come together, release our concerns and worries, open our hearts and souls, and connect with our femininity. Let's find the power in sisterhood, and empower each other by connecting and sharing our minds, hearts and souls. Let's create judgment free space to harbor our femininity and empower each other to live in this crazy and amazing city.
results.name: New York Women's Empowerment Meetup

results.description:
Our Club's Purpose

Promote Volleyball throughout Northern New Jersey, meet other volleyball players and make new friends.

Our Club's Mission Statement 
1) Provide YOU a competitive volleyball game
2) Maximize your court time and minimize your costs
3) Create a fun and social atmosphere

Our Skill Levels 
In order to match players of similar skill levels and maximize everyone's volleyball experience, here is a list of skill level descriptions. This corresponds to how our meetup events will be organized and posted. 

Beginner 

• This player has had little to no on-court experience 

• Player is learning the basic individual skills/fundamentals of the game. 

• Requires instruction on all facets of the game. 

• Player has difficulties judging where ball is going. 

• Player has difficulties controlling/keeping the ball in play. 

• Slowest game pace. 

• 90% of all points end with an unforced error.


Recreational

• This player has played some organized volleyball (i.e., local leagues, intramurals, etc) and has some on-court experience. 

• Player possesses basic individual skills/fundamentals of the game but lacks consistency. 

• Requires instruction on setting, spiking, blocking, team concepts and rules 

• Familiar with basic rules and violations, almost all illegal contacts are not called

• Player is learning to judge where the ball is going although court coverage is limited. 

• Slow game pace. Player can sustain rallies with other players of the same ability level. 

• 75% of all points end with an unforced error. Typically blocking is not required.

Intermediate

• This player has played organized volleyball (i.e., local leagues, intramurals, etc) for 5+ years and has on-court experience. 

• Player possesses basic individual skills/fundamentals of the game. 

• Player is getting familiar with positions and basic team concepts. 

• May require instruction on setting, spiking, blocking and team concepts. 

• Familiar with basic rules and violations, gross illegal contacts will be called

• Player's court coverage is average. 

• Normal game pace. Serving is more aggressive. Player can sustain rallies with other players of the same ability level. 

• Less than 40% of all points end with an unforced error. Blocking may be required.

• USA Volleyball/GEVA/VBLI player level of CC/B

Advanced

• This player has played competitive volleyball (i.e., such as high-school/college, GEVA, VBLI, or GAV) for 10+ years and has extensive on-court experience. 

• Player has mastered individual skills/fundamentals of the game. 

• Player is familiar with advanced team concepts (i.e, defensive positioning, blocking, 5-1 and 6-2 systems, specialization). 

• Familiar with USAV rules and violations, all illegal contacts will be called

• Fast game pace. Less than 10% of all points end with an unforced error (i.e., point is earned by a forced error / block). Blocking is required.

• USA Volleyball/GEVA/VBLI player level of A/BB (indoor)
results.name: Central NJ Volleyball Club

MEMBERS PLEASE NOTE:  DUE TO LOW SUMMER TURNOUT THE GROUP WILL BE TEMPORARILY CLOSED DOWN UNTIL APPROXIMATELY MID-SEPTEMBER AND THEN WILL START UP AGAIN.

Do you love movies? Do you love the awesome reclining seats at the AMC 84th Street theater on Broadway? Do you love being able to reserve seats ahead of time? Then this is the group for you. When there are films at that theater that are appropriate for the group, we'll go there. Please note that you are always personally responsible for buying your own ticket; the organizer will let the group know when she buys her ticket and will provide her seat number should you wish to sit with the group.

Sometimes, we will see films at other theaters. Your organizer will mostly keep meetups to midtown west or the upper west side (off of the "A" or "1" train lines). Following the films, we'll go out for dinner or drinks in nearby restaurants. Sometimes we'll go cheap and other times, we'll treat ourselves to a nice dinner. This is a meetup for those who love to treat themselves to dinner and a movie and find the upper west side most convenient. 

Always, always, always buy your own ticket unless the event description says otherwise (Ali gets questions about this very single event so please read . . .  YOU BUY YOUR OWN TICKET!!!). Hopefully everyone will see and read this. :-)

I look forward to meeting you all.

Ali

P.S. Please go to the "Files" link (click on "More" and then "Files") and download a copy of the group rules so that you are familiar with how the group is run.

Each month is free with your RSVP. Bring your instrument, bring your lyrics and rock on! Calling Harlem, WaHi, Inwood and the Bronx, although our jam is currently in Harlem, we still encourage all uptown lovhers to participate! WHY? Upper Manhattan is an oasis of creativity and artistic expression....It's Nina Simone meets Nas, it's Flying Lotus meets Roy Ayers, it's Prince meets J Dilla. Every month The Shrine's Hip Hop & Spoken Word Open Mic Jam Session will present live musicians, emcees, singers and spoken word artist backed by a live hip hop jam band. Feel the musical spirit of uptown that you probably believed only existed downtown. Our mission is to allow positive creative energy to flow!

We will also be sharing other cool events uptown that have live music or good music. If we think that you will like it, we will invite you. Come out and hang with the gang!

results.description:
This Meetup is an ongoing user group of technology and business professionals who are experiencing challenges with getting the necessary internet connectivity to support their businesses and operations here in ALL parts of the Five Boroughs.


Whether it be a simple cable connection or a Gig-E Fiber build out, this is a user (customer) based forum to communicate with one other on your challenges and needs for better connectivity. This Meetup will have a monthly meeting on the first Thursday of every month at the Midtown HQ of our founding sponsor (with cocktails to follow!) where we will invite a variety of specialists from different ISPs available here in NYC and other industry experts to listen to our needs and then hopefully build solutions for our members.

Membership is restricted to consumers of commercial internet connectivity ONLY with representatives from ISPs being allowed to sponsor and present their wares in a fair and organized fashion.

Even if you think you are in the farthest reaches of NYC and you're stuck with your DSL from 1999, join up and by working together we will help you catch up to the 21st Century!
results.name: CONNECTIVITY CHALLENGED IN NYC

topics.name: Big Business Strategies at Small Business Costs

results.description:
This is NOT a group for people looking to start a business or MLMers or those who just want to "join" a Meetup group.   This is NOT a networking or referral organization (that's what BNI is for).  You must be an owner or partner in an actual business (online or offline) to participate.

Are you ready for an organization that's only for business owners and is focused on helping you work "ON" your business rather than just "IN" your business? Do you want to get better, bottom-line results for your business, with the help of some of the top business people in New York, while also having fun? Whether you are a sole proprietor or have 2-150 employees, Level Up Your Business is for you!

Created by bestselling author, speaker and entrepreneur, Tim Houston, Level Up members are small business owners and entrepreneurs from a variety of different industries and ofline professions -- both online and offline -- who appreciate the ability to share ideas, solve problems and identify opportunities for one another, all with the goals of becoming more productive, profitable and prosperous!

We are a membership-based organization. Because we limit each of our local groups to a maximum of 20 business owners, our monthly meetings are fun, very interactive, positive, and strictly confidential, all with a focus on getting bottom line results for our members. At each session, we have a world-class workshop focusing on business development and a time for each of the members to share the challenges & successes they are having in their own businesses.

Membership information is given at the actual meeting but you can try Level Up Your Business by registering for as a guest one of our upcoming monthly sessions. For more information and newly forming groups, visit www.levelupyourbusiness.com
results.name: Level Up Your Business

results.description:
Our group is for Bergen County NJ (Ramsey, Allendale, Mahwah, Waldwick) Moms and their kids! MOMS Club® is geared towards Moms who are at home during the day with their children and who live in the Ramsey, NJ School District and surrounding towns. The MOMS Club® Of Ramsey is a chapter of MOMS Club® International (www.momsclub.org). MOMS Offering Moms Support®

We accept members from Ramsey and the surrounding towns.

We are a support group designed just for you, the at-home mother! You are interested in the world around you, want a variety of activities for you and your children, and are proud of your choice of at-home mothering for your families!

Being a MOMS Club® member entitles you to a monthly calendar of events that includes:

♦ Age Appropriate Playgroups ♦ Open Playgroups ♦ Playground & Park Outings ♦ Craft Activities ♦ Grocery & Restaurant tours ♦ Seasonal Parties ♦ Field Trips ♦ Stroller Walks ♦ Meals provided for members with newborns ♦ MOMS Night Out ♦ Book Club And Much More!!

Email: momscluboframsey@gmail.com for more information.
results.name: MOMS Club® of Ramsey

results.description: Calling all folks who love to bust a move, while listening to a good beat! We dance-walk our way around the Prospect Park loop together. Bring your iPod & headphones. Everybody listens to their own music. We share the company of our unabashedness and physical inspiration. The point is not to be performative or weird for weird's sake, but to let the music authentically spur movement. It is not social dancing, but more of an individual/group workout. The group togetherness and common purpose allows people to let go of their self-consciousness and have an outrageously exhilarating time! More info on what dance walking actually is and photos in Meetup Group description. Come join this fall!

results.description:
If you are compelled to write and enjoy being around others who are obsessed/possessed by words, this is the group for you. We're poets, fantasy writers, bloggers and ghost writers, and everything in between, all on a mission to create and inspire. Some of us have published several books, most are trying to finish one, others just want to get back in the habit of writing. Some of us write for a living, many don't. All are welcome. 

We split the session into discussion and writing around a topic; freeform writing and discussion around a random or pre-chosen writing prompt; and individual project discussion. Project discussion is limited to under 10 minutes, depending on how many people participate. We have a website, where group members will be able to post projects for group comments. Check out http://www.nywritingclub.com.

We meet once a month, sometimes at the same location, sometimes not. We also at times will meet in a coffee shop or go out for drinks after. To get a good feel for who we are and what we're about, read a description of one of our past meetups.

If you appreciate the art of writing and expressing yourself in words, why not come share it with others. Let's gain inspiration and meet one another. 

"Writing means sharing. It's part of the human condition to want to share things - thoughts, ideas, opinions." --Paulo Coelho
results.name: New York Writing Club

Members are welcome to suggest meetups at our location or any other place they find convenient for cooking and eating together.  Our place is available for meetups only after 3:00 p.m. any day of the week.  With some additional chairs, we can seat up to 20 people.  There is plenty of free parking for everybody. The kitchen provides enough space for attending members to help with cooking. We work together, cook together, eat together, and then cleanup together. We love to try cooking foods from all different ethnic backgrounds.  Our members are from all over the world. We are an LGBT friendly group.

Thank you for your interest. Join us today!

What's Cooking?

results.description:
Welcome to the Church of New York Meetup. This meetup is for those with an earnest desire to study the scriptures, seek after God, obey God and fellowship with other brethren who are also striving for the faith of the Gospel. Are you born again or desire to be according to John 3:5-7, have you been baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of your sins and been filled with the Holy Ghost as the disciples were as recorded in the book of Acts? (Acts 2:4,38-39) Do you love the name of Jesus Christ above all other names (Acts 4:12) and love to talk about what Jesus Christ has done for you in your life? If so, join us as we get together to exhort, strengthen and encourage one another in the faith. 

     This Meetup Group will be an opportunity for you to share your testimony, songs, exhortations, teachings, prophesyings, revelations and preachings according to gift of God given unto you-provided they are in agreement with the Word of God. This meetup group is for Christians and disciples who desire to get back to the scriptures, to sound doctrine, and to the practices of the original book of Acts church. Our Meetup theme is "Continuing Stedfastly in the Apostles Doctrine", as it is written:  "And they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers." (Acts 2:42)  Join us as we pray, study the Word of God, labor together in the harvest, and endeavor to come into the unity of the faith, by continuing steadfastly in the Apostles' doctrine and fellowship.

results.description:
Our intention is to bring together people at the nexus of consciousness-raising, social entrepreneurship and social change to network and to spotlight individuals, projects, movements, NGO's, and for-good companies that are extending love and creativity into the world in ways that inspire others to do the same. 

We will attempt to bring a spiritual perspective to themes such as environmentalism, sustainability, human rights, economic justice and women's empowerment. From the point of view of spirit, "nothing real can be threatened" [A Course in Miracles]. From this perspective, it is madness to try to change anyone or anything; however, this conclusion hardly precludes action! Once freed from the need to change ourselves or others, we can devote all our thoughts to sharing our love and creativity, and there are an infinite variety of ways we can be kind and helpful to one another. In fact, it is only through sharing our inner creativity and unconditional love that we remember and realize our limitlessness.

To this end we envision hosting documentary film screenings, mixers, lectures, fundraisers, panel discussions, Q&As, and, perhaps later, organizing and/or participating in various social good projects. We value diversity and inclusivity  and invite you to share your voice with the community.
results.name: Spirituality & Social Change Meetup

You're encouraged to live with passion, do the things that bring you joy and give you a sense of purpose and fulfillment, think positively all the times.


In this group you will also receive

• Support in various forms 

• Encouragement & inspiration to keep your head up and moving forward

• New friends & a community to grow with 

• Advice to help you make better decisions in your journey of life


Enjoy Life it's not just a saying it's a way of life. Be free from worry my friend. 

"Alone we beg. Together we make demands."

Smax Music

www.smaxmusic.com

results.description:
After joining multiple Meetups and meeting people in everyday situations, I have confirmed that the life of an Introvert isn't easy. For those of us who are outgoing, we may attract those who don't quite understand us, leaving them feeling like we are not interested in establishing (or maintaining) friendships, or that we dislike people. This is normally not the truth for most Introverts. Many of us desire and want meaningful friendships but our dominant need to be in our own, undisrupted thoughts sometimes get in the way.

This Meetup is for Introverts (and those who can or want to understand us) who want to meet new people (and possibly establish some meaningful friendships), mingle, and partake in social activities.

Free Myers Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) Test: http://www.humanmetrics.com/cgi-win/jtypes2.asp

You’re expecting twins or your twins are 0-6months! You have a million questions and you don’t know where to start. Plus you have no idea who to talk to. You need some answers and you need a support system to get you through it.

results.description: Have a really bright kid with learning and/or social challenges? Twice exceptionally gifted kids may experience school-based issues, difficulty finding and forming meaningful peer relationships and managing challenges at home. Parents' needs are often as unique as their children's in finding solutions for school and home related issues, and finding an understanding peer group to share strengths and struggles with in a safe and nonjudgmental environment. As a consultant, licensed clinical therapist, and the parent of a young adult who is gifted and has struggled in traditional school settings, I am hosting monthly gatherings for parents of twice exceptionally gifted children and adolescents. If you think that you have a twice exceptional child, but aren't sure, feel free to contact me.
results.name: Sea Cliff Parents of Gifted/Twice Exceptional Kids Meetup

results.description:
Hello and welcome to Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special. 

When you come to a Date Walking event, you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 5 to 15 wo/men over the course of an hour or two. Once you've met everyone, we usually get food and/or drinks somewhere. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face.

Some of my more popular and repeating Date Walks are: 

► Big Group Brooklyn Bridge Sunset Singles Walk
► Big Group Central Park Singles Stroll
► Big Group Singles 3-Bridge Walk
► Big Group Singles Roosevelt Island Walk
► Big Group Singles Stroll around Astoria
► Big Group Singles Sunset Walk on the High Line
► Big Group Date Walk for Dog Lovers  

If you have any questions, comments, concerns or ideas, please do not hesitate to get in touch. 

Thank you,
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer
 
Call/Text: 347-225-3516
Email: datewalking@gmail.com

Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter 


I've tried Plenty of Fish, OKcupid, Coffee meets Bagel, Craigslist, Tinder and so on and it's the same thing every time: a little bit of back-and-forth communication that eventually diminishes to nothing. Either that or you actually meet a person here and a person there and there's no chemistry so it's over. More wasted time. I've been hosting walking events on Meetup groups for over 3 years and as far as I'm concerned, it's the best way to meet a woman because you're not just meeting 1 woman. It's like going on a date with 10 to 50 women at once and you get to walk and talk to them all. The only problem with regular walking groups is that you don't know who's single and who' isn't. With Date Walking you know.
results.name: Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special

If you are planning to run Paris 2015 Marathon and want to meet others, who are planning to do the same, please join the group and let's get ready for this wonderful event together.
results.name: New York Marathon Meetup for Paris 39th 2015 Marathon

results.description:
Brooklyn Breathwork is a monthly gathering that honors the sacred gift of life through the gentle and transformative modality of rebirthing breathwork. 

All evenings are by donation with a suggested donation of $20 per person. We also host special evenings with lightworkers and healers. We are here to create a conscious, sacred and supportive community in the heart of one of the greatest cities in the world. Breathe on with love!

Rebirthing Breathwork, also commonly referred to as rebirthing or conscious connected breathing, is an acceleration of the healing process through an exploration and practice of the breath. Bypassing the mind entirely, the rebirthing breath goes deep into your cells, saturating the body with both oxygen and life force, and helps to release any negative self-thought, perceived limitations, past trauma or any uncomfortable feelings that are held in the body. It is a truly transformational modality that helps the breather recognize their union with their higher self and all of life with peace and absolute love.
results.name: Brooklyn Breathwork

results.description:
Our Meetup Purpose: This is a group for mature Myers-Briggs "iNtuitive Feelers" (NF) who want to meet other intuitive feelers for deeper and more intimate conversations and connections.  Approximately one in ten people fit the NF personality profile.  If you are not sure if you fit the profile, click "Pages" up above, and click on the free test link to take a personality test.  

Our group of NFs will favor positive, uplifting, and inspiring conversations amongst those of us over 30 years old.  It will be a supportive environment where we can learn and grow. I believe that we "idealists" have the most amazing potential to do good in our society. Let's SUPPORT one another in our dreams, our goals, and investing our amazing potential back into our families, our society, and in our world!


What Wikipedia says about us:  "As the identity-seeking temperament, Idealists long for meaningful communication and relationships. They search for profound truths hidden beneath the surface, often expressing themselves in metaphor. Focused on the future, they are enthusiastic about possibilities, and they continually strive for self-renewal and personal growth.

Idealists strive to discover who they are and how they can become their best possible self -- always this quest for self-knowledge and self-improvement drives their imagination - and Idealists yearn to help others make the journey too."
results.name: NYC Idealists - NF (INFP, INFJ, ENFP, ENFJ) meetup (Age 30+)

results.description: Learn, practice, improve, and enjoy dancing Argentine tango at these two weekly practicas. Rebecca, an expert in the field, dancing tango 24 years now, will spend time with any dancer wanting some help on the dance floor. This is a great bargain because each practica costs $12/person and you're getting a mini-private-lesson and lots of nice people to practice with, snacks, great music, beautiful dance floor. Racing Club Practica meets every Thursday 9 pm to 12:00 am and Rawson Practica meets every Saturday 2 to 5 pm at Stepping Out Studios, 37 W 26th Street, 9th floor. Rebecca also offers a full program of classes and lessons, and you can read more about those at rebeccatango.com. But this Meetup group is all about practicing at whatever skill level you are currently enjoying, and getting ready to go out to milongas and simply dance, express the music, connect with a partner, and have some intense fun!
results.name: New York Tango Practica Meetup - Rebecca Hosts

results.description:
Why you should join solo2musicent weekend night outs?

Together we dig deep, play big and don’t stop until goals are fulfilled and lessons learned. We care, we love what we do and we walk our talk.


The Handel Method®

The Handel Method® was created by Handel Group® co-founder Lauren Zander over the past 15 years. The method is the foundation for courses we teach at institutions such as MIT, NYU and Stanford, the work we do within companies such as AOL, BASF, Sony, BP, and The New York Times, and the coaching that we provide to individuals. The method is revolutionary yet easy to understand, methodical yet customizable. The Handel Method® is based on a belief in the power of speaking the truth, and in Personal Integrity® as the most direct avenue toward creating permanent change in any area of life. We work with clients to address their fears, thoughts, and negative beliefs so that they are free to invent a life they love.


For more information on the Handel Group, please visit

topics.name: Practicing the early stages of Argentine Tango

results.description:
Welcome at Ultimate Tango!

Here you find all you need to become a true member of Tango community. We focus on developing in you the truth understanding of what Tango is.

Tango is not just a dance. It’s philosophy, the way of comprehending the world, the way of building relationships, the way to understand yourself.

Here at Ultimate Tango we teach you the tango alphabet, we teach you how to create words, we teach you basic rules, basic steps, basic combinations. We teach you all you need to know about music, connection, lead and follow, types of tangos and more. From there you can launch onto your own journey to discover what Tango means for you. 

We don’t want to limit you with multitude of steps and clatter your memory with combinations you can never remember. Our goal is to give you the true understanding of Tango structure and music, mechanics of the movement, technique and cadence. From there you can start improvising on you own. Find your own style.

We offer carefully structured courses in Tango, Vals and Milonga at 3 different levels – beginner, intermediate, advanced at 3 different locations: New York City NY, West New York NJ and Boston MA. We also offer workshops to address more specialized topics. Private lessons are available for those who wish to progress at their own pace.

DON'T REPEAT MINDLESSLY. LEARN THROUGH UNDERSTANDING.
results.name: Ultimate Tango NYC Meetup

Welcome to the Central NJ chapter of Teach and Learn Networking!

Events - Community - Consulting

Entrepreneurs, business professionals, we know how you feel about networking. It sucks. Unless there's free wine involved, walking up to strangers and talking about work (after you've worked all day) sounds like torture.

Does a professional networking event have to feel like a middle school dance? No.

Teach and Learn Networking believes in curating environments where sharing ideas, resources, and network power feels natural. 

How do we do that?

Good question. Conversation and education.

You'll participate in facilitated networking activities (a fancy word for ice breakers) to get the conversation flowing with the most electric entrepreneurs, biz professionals, c-suite execs, and startups in our area. We know that honing your skill set is essential to your $uccess, so our speakers focus on teaching, not selling. 

What are people saying about us? Check out some testimonials here, or scroll back through our past events and check the comments. 

We also provide private consulting and management services for businesses looking to amplify their message with events! Contact us for more info.

Our newsletter (coming Jan 2016!) and membership to our group is free. If you’d like to sponsor, do a giveaway, or be a vendor at an upcoming event, contact Sam Popp at samanthaepopp@gmail.com

Welcome to our official home on meetup.com! eSports Heroes is a global organization of gamers who care deeply about the growing world of electronic sports. Over the last decade, online gaming has become a staple of modern life. Thus, professional gaming has exploded in popularity and is now the fastest growing entertainment genre among young adults globally. The world of eSports is an uncharted, untapped frontier from which we can establish ourselves as early adopters.

eSports Heroes of NYC is the original ESH chapter. We are an ambitious group of like minded entrepreneurs who care deeply about the advancement of this industry and will help spearhead this movement to make eSports synonymous with sports. 

If you are interested in making new friends, forging professional relationships, and becoming part of this growing industry feel free to join.

results.description:
About Team In Training

Our athletes have walked away with new friends, amazing accomplishments and the sense that they did something even more important than getting in good shape. How serious is blood cancer? Every three minutes, someone new is diagnosed with blood cancer. Every 10 minutes, someone dies. In exchange for training and support, you help raise money towards cures for blood cancers leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin’s disease and myeloma -- the No. 1 disease killer of children is leukemia.

The Reason Why

• Coaching and training. Travel to a major marathon, half marathon, century, hiking adventure or triathlon in exciting locations.

• The opportunity to make your athletic goals a reality (an unbeatable offer with great personal rewards).

• A connection with an honored patient so you know just who and what you’re doing it all for.

As the largest endurance sports training program in the world, we will provide you with the experience of a lifetime.

Events 

If you’ve ever wanted to run, walk, or run/walk 26.2, 13.1, or 6.2 miles, now is your chance to join the TEAM that is saving lives. Visit our website at http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for a current listing of our Fall and Winter season events.

Contact

Please contact Margo Cianchetta at margarita.cianchetta@lls.org or 908.956.6628, or visit http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for more information.

GO TEAM!
results.name: Get Fit, Have Fun, and Help Cure Cancer!

results.description:
Looking to spend more time in Bay Ridge? I am, having returned to Brooklyn after a decade in Queens! Perhaps, like me, you do a lot in Manhattan, but wish you could also just hang around the neighborhood with new friends. We  brunch, lunch, and dine in various restaurants in Bay Ridge, as well as go to local community-building events, like concerts and fairs. While the focus is here in Bay Ridge, we venture off to venues in other parts of Brooklyn, like the Brooklyn Museum and the Heights Players. Membership is NOT limited to only those living in Bay Ridge or even Brooklyn, so those "out on the island" or in one of the other boroughs are welcome, too!

Similar to most meetups, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors" has a modest $1 organizing fee per event, payable to me at the start of an event, to offset the subscription cost of maintaining the meetup.

Please note our No-Show Policy: Because we've been kept waiting in lobbies, etc., for folks who didn't bother to change their rsvps, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors"  has a "no-show" policy where any member who incurs ONE no-show with no explanatory emails to me will be permanently removed from our membership rolls and not be allowed to rsvp for any more of our events. After all, would you keep a "friend" who stood you up and never apologized? Let's all respect each other's time and enjoy ourselves with a minimum of discomfort.

Like what you see about "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors "? Then consider joining our sister groups, "Great Places in Gotham" (http://www.meetup.com/The-Great-Places-in-Gotham-Meetup/) , which focuses primarily on Manhattan events and museums, and "Friendly Native New Yorker Walking Tours" (http://www.meetup.com/Friendly-Native-New-Yorker-Walking-Tours/), where as a licensed NYC tour guide, I lead various walking tours in Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens!
results.name: The (Mostly!) Bay Ridge Neighbors Meetup

results.description:
This is not a sit around group, this is trial by fire. If you want to get involved in video production, and are an adult of sound mind and body this may be for you. We meet to voluntarily exchange media and production work.

The rules:

RULE #1: You are not a participant, you are a reporter of the news, you do not place your self in danger, you do not place others in danger, you do not personally comment on situations or editorialize, you cover others at the event talking. They are the subject, not any of us in the meetup.

RULE #2: If you want to make sure what you want get's published, either publish it your self on social media, or, convince someone in the group or outside of the group to publish. Just because you are part of the group, does not mean anyone has any obligation to contribute to your work. This is a loosely based meetup.

RULE #3: Bring your skills. If you like being a reporter, if you want to do audio engineering, if you want to write music with true current social meaning, then this is an opportunity.

RULE #4: Try to share your skills with others, there will always be video to produce, if you want to do video production, audio production, anything in the stream to create a news worthy news piece, this is your opportunity.

RULE #5: Do this because you enjoy it, try to have fun, help others, try make meaning of the chaos.

RULE #6: We attend public meeting using Open Meeting Law, in New Jersey this means you can only video speakers or officials, due to NJ draconian laws the public in a meeting has a 'right to privacy' at a meeting. In New York all present at meeting may be recorded.  Recording can not interfere with an orderly meeting. NOTE: Every meeting will generate media to produce, I will generate it and provide it under Creative Commons, so if you are downstream of Video and Audio capture, don't worry, you will always have at least my work to work with.

I started this group when I found out that out of a city of 6+ million, there was no planned coverage of THE Post Ambrose LNG public hearing in Queens. It does not matter if you are a Conservative, Liberal, Progressive or any other affiliation. If you want to get involved with video production, this is an opportunity. For my personal work, I always publish creative commons, unless I included copy write material granted to me specifically for my production. Musicians and Sound engineers are badly needed.

FYI

BE PREPARED! 

Federal and State hearings for unpopular infrastructure projects happen many times in the dead of winter, on the coldest evening with virtually no public transit access.  When I was at the Queens meeting it was dark and in the teens,  I could not imagine any elderly person or sane person taking a multi-link trip to that location, and saw none waiting at bus stop.

If you want to be on the short list of people to be notified of short notice events, contact me.  I always announce on the website, but sometimes less than 24 hours are given in advance notice.
results.name: (All Volunteer) Independent News Media

Want more out of life? Our mission is to create more fun, freedom and fulfillment in the lives of EVERYONE. Admit it, you are either in dire need of fun or you love to have fun. What better way to exercise that fun bone than traveling the world with friends and family, meeting some fun and amazing people, and participating in fun filled excursions. Best part about it is that you decide what fun is for you. What does freedom mean to you? Freedom from mediocrity. Maybe you are time broke, always working and never have time with family. Maybe you have too much time and no money to do the things you love to do. Everyone could use a little extra money or a lot of extra money. One thing is for sure, we would all love more quality time with family and friends. You decide what you would like to be free from or free to do. Here's my favorite part of what we are centered around; fulfillment. What would make you feel fulfilled in life? What are your dreams and aspirations in life? What if you surrounded yourself around goal-oriented, ambitious and hard-working individuals, is it safe to say your lifestyle will change for the better? Better yet, is it safe to say you become who you surround yourself around? If after answering these questions you have even an ounce of curiosity or interest than you are who we are looking for. See you soon on the beaches of the world!! LETS CONNECT...

any questions contact me 646-228-7922

Bonjour,


This group is all about French culture and activities in New York, and there are a LOT !
You will learn about events, food, people, how to socialize more efficiently to make real life friends, or even find your soul mate (ha ! the French !). This group is also ideal for you if you are new in town.

results.description:
Food and Drink Adventures is geared towards thirty-somethings who want to explore the culinary and nightlife playground that is New York. More than just a drinking and dining-out group, this group is about learning and experiencing all that we consume--as it relates to culture, heritage, history and so much more! 

A few things to note: 

1) Events: All events will be designed to foster friendship.  Dinners will not have large attendance lists, whereas happy hours will not be capped.  

2) Age: This group is intended for people in their 30's.  I'd appreciate it if you respect that. 

3) In an effort to stem the amount of people who RSVP and fail to show up, I’m going to implement the following policy for any person who RSVPs for the 1st time to an event that has a set reservation number and has not shown up to any past events:

When you RSVP as a 1st Timer, I will send you a message to confirm that you will be attending the event. To confirm, simply respond to my message within 48 hours, and you’ll remain on the RSVP list. In the event I do not hear back from you within those 48 hours, if there’s a wait-list, I will remove you from the RSVP list to have someone from the wait-list take your spot.

So please be sure you have your meetup settings allowing me as organizer to send you messages through meetup directly.

4) Removal: If you’re been a member of the group for six months and haven’t RSVP’d or attended a single event, then I reserve the right to remove you from the group. I know that there are a ton of meetup options for one to partake in this great city, but I hope that if you signed up for this group, you’re genuinely interested in giving it a shot – stop by for a drink at one the the next happy hours, or take a chance and try a new cuisine while meeting some new folks. 

Also, if you've RSVP'd to at least 2 meetups, and fail to show up without changing your RSVP and/or notifying me of your absence, I reserve the right to remove you from the group. C'mon, guys - it takes 2 seconds to change your RSVP and/or notify me - I don't have the patience for flaky people - feel free to join another group that will tolerate such behavior.

5) Fees: I think it's lame that meetup has fees to begin with and hasn't figured out a way to generate revenue without holding Head Organizers liable for such costs, but it is what it is...with that being said, I'm not sure if there will be a nominal fee for meetups at some later point in time - as I just took over for the previous organizer, I'm still trying to figure this out.

If all this sounds good to you, then join us! :)
results.name: Food and Drink Adventures (30s)

results.description:
This is a group for girls who live in Greenpoint and Williamsburg. Meetups will include a little bit of everything - dinners, happy hours, fitness activities, shopping, galleries, coffee, festivals, and more! Girls in this group should be in their 20s and 30s only, no exceptions. Most events will have attendance limits, because it's easier to get to know each other in a smaller group! However, don't be discouraged by the waitlist - people tend to cancel in the days right before the event, so you definitely can make it into the events from the waitlist! Inactive members are subject to removal, so please try to make it to some of the events! **I will frequently remove all members who have not even looked at the group page in over a month.** This group will remain small, so we're all able to get to know each other!

*Attendance Policy:

*Respect and consideration for others are Top Priority; be considerate by refraining from being a "NO SHOW" (Not showing up and leaving your RSVP a "yes", or changing RSVP to a "no" within 2 hours of an event and not communicating with the organizer) or a "LATE CANCEL" (Cancelling out of an event within 24 hrs of the event).

*Events take work for organizers to coordinate, especially those requiring RSVPs. Make sure you are able to make it to an event to which you RSVP and if you anticipate a conflict or being late, give us a heads up. We understand that things come up and life interferes, but please do your best. ;)

*If you find that you can't make it to something you've signed up for -- CHANGE YOUR RSVP as soon as possible, or call/text/message an organizer/event host if it is within 2 hours of the event. Events take time & energy to plan. If you don't show up AND make no effort to let the Event Planner know what happened --- that's a "NO SHOW".

*No Show/Late Cancel policy: If you have a history of doing this (we keep track of attendance on your profile), we won't be able to count on you to show up when you say you are going to. Out of respect and courtesy to others that DO show up, we may bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space in favor of those with a positive attendance history. If you make a habit out of no showing or late cancelling, we may remove you from the group.
results.name: Greenpoint Girls

For too long, too many Jewish gay men ended up dating non-Jewish men because (a) there aren't that many of out there to begin with;  and (b) with gay couples, starting a family and having a "Jewish home," was not as much a priority as for a heterosexual couple. But now that's changing. More gay couples are starting families. We strive to be an alternative to those events around the City where supposedly one can meet gay Jewish men, but which can be a bit clique-ish (and also very expensive). We also limit our membership to men who are ADULTS - we will take men in their early 30's, but our IDEAL range is really mid-to-late-30's, 40's and 50's.

results.description: We all have knowledge and talents to share- so let's get together and teach and learn from each other! This is an opportunity to build a community through a "smorgasbord of knowledge" that we constantly create. The idea is simple: Every two weeks we will meet to experience something led by one of the members of the group. We will each have an opportunity to sign up to teach a topic, lead a workshop, give a lecture or anything in between for up to 45 minutes. This is a chance to try new things and have different experiences that we hope, in turn, will build community. As members of this group we have one goal: to help grow our community of knowledge by sharing of ourselves and of course, have fun in the process! That means simply participating or signing up to lead us in a presentation. Is there anything you've always wanted to try but never did or a way you've wanted to push yourself, or something you love deeply that you wish you did more? Anything can be the theme of your presentation to the group- from a juggling workshop to a lecture on evolution to a story of your travels to origami- what matters is that you bring something to the group that you love and are excited to share. On your assigned presentation week please be sure to come prepared with any materials you might need and of course let the group know if anything should be done in advance. Then  the rest of us will learn, grow, and be enriched....until it's our turn to present and enrich others! And don't forget everyone bring your favorite wine or beer to share with the group for some mingling after the presentation!

topics.name: The Impact of Lyme on your Life

results.description:
" But you look so good?"  Sound familiar?  Lyme disease is one of the "invisible diseases" and often lyme patients suffer consequences of "not looking sick" - jobs are lost, family and friends don't understand, doctors don't believe you or want to treat you, etc., etc. In addition, Lyme Patients often, due to crushing fatigue and pain, find themselves alone and isolated unable to go to work or socialize, which can negatively impact one's ability to recover.

This group is Open to Lyme Disease Patients and Friends and Family of Lyme Patients for the purpose of establishing a community of support and creating a safe venue for sharing experiences, challenges, information and camaraderie.  Located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, the meetings are facilitated by an acupuncturist, sound healer and experienced meditator, who is also diagnosed with neurological lyme. Sessions will include guided-meditation, group discussion and possibly sound/music therapy.
results.name: NYC Lyme Disease Support Group

results.description: Calling experienced and newbie hang gliders in New York City. Let's learn from each other as we explore the region's hang gliding scene. What are the best schools, air fields, and more? Urban beginners in particular can benefit from veteran pilots' wisdom. Join the gang for comradeship about the most thrilling pastime.
results.name: NYC Hanggliders

results.description:
This is a group consisting of individuals interested in discovering how to walk through various NYC streets and look for how to "read" the streets for interesting architectural and historic facts. As a licensed NYC Tour Guide, I will show you how to detect a specific historic block, and then we'll  determine the reason that block is "historic". We'll them move onto other sites where I'll share some stories you in turn can share with your friends(who aren't lucky enough to have joined the group).

I started this group as I wanted to share my knowledge with New Yorkers(native or new) during my slow winter season when I'm not as busy with foreigners and student groups. Since one  of my hobbies is photography, we'll definitely stop by some spots where you can take "bug eye" or "bird's eye" photos and truly realize how those descriptors came about…In fact, as we walk, you may end up suggesting and sharing with the group a better photo ops that the ones I have planned!

 My goal is for all of us to have fun and take away  lasting memories from our time together exploring New York. An extra  bonus would be if some of you decide to meet again (either in a group setting or just an informal twosome), but there are no guarantees. HOWEVER, at the end of the walk, I plan on enjoying a  a low cost snack in an  indoor public space. I hope you all decide to join me for our "Apres Walk"(i.e. my version of "Apres Ski" fun). Incidentally,  you can either bring something with you or purchase something along the way. 

I'll also be happy to share with you info on some  other upcoming   low cost/freebie events/venues for the coming week. I hope you can also  share some other FREEBIE events info with our group. For example, after a Friday walk in  midtown Manhattan, I can direct you to 2 midtown museums where on  Fridays 1 is FREE and the other is "pay-as-you-wish" night. 



The $15 charge per person is to help cover administrative costs. You still will be getting a tour very similar to  my $250 private tours.

Thank you for becoming a member and I hope you join some  of our tours soon!
results.name: Artful, Fun , NYC Walking/Talking Detective Walkers...

results.description:
This workshop introduces performing techniques that business professionals can start using to master the “soft” skills that many companies are seeking – creativity, communication, teamwork, leadership and strong interpersonal skills.

Objectives
1. Use performing techniques to improve your charisma and presence.
2. Learn to stretch your comfort zone and manage stage fright. Take risks. Think creatively. Think fast on your feet.
3. Discover how to market yourself to colleges or employers. What makes you unique? Gain new awareness of your public persona.

Details
Each workshop is different and may focus on new skills or build upon previous exercises. We provide a supportive environment for beginners.

The workshop may start out with a guided vocal and physical warm up. The awakening of vocal resonators and energizing the body will make you grounded in any job interview or business presentation.

We may do a series of improvisational acting exercises geared towards getting you out of your comfort zone to create characters, stories and conflict within a scene on the spot. This gears you for being quick on your feet and thinking fast in the work place, and also gets people out of their comfort zone as they create these quirky and extroverted characters.

Other exercises will involve using all these acting tools in a business setting.

For meet up members the price is $20 per class. If you would like unlimited monthly classes for $49, please check out https://bookeo.com/academyonbroadway/signup

For more workshops, check out www.academyonbroadway.com

results.description:
About Theology on Tap: Have you ever noticed that sometimes your best and deepest theological reflections happen outside of your place of worship, when you are hanging out with friends? We have too, and that is the whole idea behind Theology on Tap.  Our Theology on Tap is for those who embrace the questions, rather than those who embrace answers - meaning that if you are hoping to tell everyone your "truth," but are unwilling to listen to the "truth" of others, this isn't for you.  This is for people of all faiths, all denominations within faiths, and those who are seekers.  And, as a result, it has really taken off! Past topics have included “Pluralism: How can we talk about God without killing each other?”, “Faith: What’s that all about?”, and “Why are we here?: An exploration of the meaning of our existence.” The topic in January will be “A New Year, A New Faith?: What questions and challenges do we need to explore in the year ahead, and which spiritual practices are best for you?”

For directions, go to the Fitzgerald’s website by clicking on this link: http://www.fitzgeralds1928.com/

results.description:
This workshop is for those who want to reclaim the power to live your life fully. By learning ancient Toltec techniques to master awareness, shift limiting beliefs, and change your story, you bring YOU back to life and reclaim your authenticity and happiness. 

You will learn how to integrate The 4 agreements (by don Miguel Ruiz) into every day life and learn ancient Toltec tools (recapitulation, mirroring, dreaming, intent) to recreate your dream with integrity and love. In the workshop series, we will do exercises to master each of the 4 agreements (Be Impeccable With Your Word, Don't Take Anything Personally, Don't Make Assumptions, Always Do Your Best), learn healing techniques to release fear at the cell level, and create a community of support and action moving toward creating our new dream with awareness. 

Each workshop will have a topic related to one of the agreements, exercises or games, and open time for support, a closing ceremony and homework to integrate into daily life. It will be fun, uplifting, powerful and supportive group which will meet bi-weekly. You can go to all the classes or pop in to any one, because they will each be complete in their own way and do not progress in a specific order or sequence. All the agreements are addressed over and over again from different aspects, and different exercises, tools etc are shared to help integrate each one into daily life.
results.name: Awaken Through Dreaming Meditation & Healing Exercises!

Do you speak an uncommon language such as Klingon? Do you enjoy playing with words, make puns, and quietly amazed at what you have done? Well, it's time to get together and exchange the languages, words, and puns. All levels are welcome!

results.description:
Entrepreneurship is an art form, responsible in part for shaping the state of human affairs. As innovators and members of a global community we should strive to better understand the nature of our thoughts and actions. Why do we defy the odds to pursue our goals? How can we transcend ego, cultivate mindfulness and calibrate our efforts to serve a greater good?

Insight awakens by calming the mind and peering inward; A daunting task for the often extroverted entrepreneur. While it may be difficult or appear as counter-productive, we can expand our awareness of self and thus begin to realize the innate wisdom that has become buried under layers of social conditioning. 

While this process may be confusing or even spiritually disruptive, it is the first step toward rejecting the “me first” mentality in favor of benevolence. Let’s explore such topics in the context of entrepreneurship through community-driven discussions, with an objective to challenge our present beliefs and redefine what it means to be a leader in modern business.
results.name: Philosophy of Social Entrepreneurship

results.description:
Welcome to the FAB Women!

As women, entrepreneurs, and corporate executives we *ARE* more than just business. We are "OUR" business! We want to connect like-minded individuals interested in growing themselves and their business to help each other succeed.

Here you will find an avenue of opportunity, a network of all things possible; we are a community committed to connecting, empowering and inspiring women to a "Live an Authentic life that is Happy, Healthy & Free!"

The goal of FABulous Women is to connect, empower and inspire — creating a space where women come together to share experiences, insights and resources all while having fun and making meaningful connections to build themselves and their businesses!

We run both live & online events that are energizing & inspiring - with a focus on personal growth , wellness and business.

Become a member of FABulous Women today and discover a world of new possibilities, real connections, fresh inspiration and unbelievable growth!

This Community is for you if you:

• don’t really like networking events
• if you want to get down to work quickly and forgo the chit chat
• are very busy and find it hard to find the time to meet with people after a networking event
• believe in helping others grow their business
• feel frustrated with the noise and distraction and want the tools to grow yourself and your business

Community Guidelines:

• Business cards are given upon request - not passed out like a poker hand.  :0)
• Help us know WHO you are and what you need (not only what you do) – this gathering is business building through needs discussions
• No annual membership – if you find value here, you will come back because you want to

This Community is *not* for you if you:

• are here to only solicit for clients/customers/team members
• aren’t interested in helping and referring community members
• are judgmental of others or closed-minded to unique business offerings
results.name: FABulous Women

This group is to provide companionship and support to you in all of your ventures and adventures. There is no need to be alone; whatever you want to do, we will do it with you. The one rule is you must in turn be just as supportive to other group members. This group is to help create real friendships and a loving communal environment. It is for people who like to communicate and share, people who like learning about and accepting differences of others. If you want to let your guard down and just live, then this group is for you. Do you have, friends that don't do the things you like to do, no friends, are you new to the area, or love making new friends...then this group is for you.

Each week a member will have the opportunity to suggest and host something she wants to do, read a book together, debate and idea, travel to a crazy place, make a video, whatever it is YOU NAME IT we will do it.  

We will support each other, learn something new, but especially learn how to work with and be supportive of one another.  Don't speak about it be about it; let's do it ladies.  There are too many people on this planet to be alone.

More and more people are working for themselves today. Many of them call themselves "freelancers", "Independent contractors", "self-employed" etc. If this is you, this is the group for you. It's about collaborating with others to bring your work to a new level. Each one of you can now have a team behind you. This meetup is a place where you can meet the members of that team.

Who should join?

Are you:
a graphic designer?
an illustrator?
a programmer or developer?
a presentation specialist?
a writer?
a marketing specialist?
a photographer?
a videographer?
a creative director or art director?

Come enjoy a fun art night focused on figure drawing from a live model. No teaching or instruction, just a casual place to unwind after the work week, meet local creatives, refresh your artistic skills, or drink until you're talented! No need to be a pro, stick figures and hand-turkey’s welcome! 

Bring your friends or enjoy an evening of creative exploration and meeting local artists. Each Friday will have a unique theme, new models, and plenty to drink!

$10 entrance includes a beer, wine or non-alcoholic beverage which are also available for purchase along with light snacks and pastries.

topics.name: How to Market Your Business through Blogging

results.description:
Why Join The Blogger Babes Meetup group? 

It can get lonely for anyone trying to blog her way to the top. That’s why we formed The Blogger Babes. It’s not just an  association –  it’s more like a sisterhood. We help each other out, from sharing useful tips  to collaborating with members to create awesome content together.

You’ll benefit from our experienced bloggers - those that have been blogging for quite a while and who actually make a living from their blog - to our handy tips and tools , networking opportunities and the educational webinars we coordinate at least twice a month.

We offer some pretty exciting (and exclusive) stuff:

· Socializing and Networking Opportunities: Hang out with your fellow bloggers, both in person and virtually! We organize parties, meetups and webinars for our Blogger Babes. 

· Exclusive Content: Hone your skills, cultivate new ideas and pick up a few tips with our content – ebooks, articles, webinars and more! Only available to Blogger Babes members.

·Support: The Blogger Babes are a friendly bunch – and we encourage members to reach out to one another, to make friends, collaborate, give encouragement and seek advice from members. You can’t do everything by yourself, and you shouldn’t have to when your fellow blogger babes are such excellent sources of support.

Goodies & Gifts & Sponsored Opportunities: We're continuously working to find sponsors for our bloggers. It's a win-win situation for both parties - our sponsors get exposure and feedback about their products & services, and our bloggers get to try out new products and services for free . This also gives a chance for our newer bloggers to learn how to review products the right way ( yes, there is a right and wrong way to write spectacular product reviews that will keep your sponsors coming back and your readers clamoring for more..).

Does this all sound exciting? Come join us and start blogging better now, and do tell all the other bloggers  in your life to join the Blogger Babes movement.

PS:Make sure you subscribe to our no-cost newsletter at www.bloggerbabes.com to get all of this week’s valuable content in condensed form.
results.name: Blogger Babes NYC + Tristate

results.description:
Hosting is about sharing your version of the American lifestyle with your international student through culture and hospitality. Your home is called a "homestay" and in this home you live a homestay lifestyle. 

This group is for both existing host and new host family who want to join the club and host students. It's for host who want to be part of a group sharing ideas, stories, tips, and even time together to help make each hosting experience an interesting one. 

I started this group because hosting for 15 years, I live a homestay lifestyle. Everything I do revolves around hosting directly and indirectly. There are many other host families in NYC who are doing the same thing but on their own. As a group we can meet for dinner, share stories and advice. Once a year we may even group together and go on an overseas vacation! An urban homestay lifestyle in NYC is positively unique.

results.description:
Central NJ Strategic Design + Tech

Driven to ensure New Jersey is a viable state to start and develop businesses, we are gathering creative technologists to discuss our thriving ecosystem of innovators, educators, engineers, entrepreneurs, policy makers, and the capital community.

Mission

The mission of this group is to support and aid people from all markets and technology areas. Our hope is to help people accelerate the process, and reduce the risk of moving from concept, into production and releasing to the public market. We want to help educate on new ways of designing, prototyping, building and fulfilling tech hardware, software, systems, & components.


We will be focused on:

• Startups, Entrepreneurialism, and Growing Business in NJ

• Strategic Design & Sustainable Business Models

• Disruption and Innovation

• User Experience (UX)

• Manufacturing

• Hardware and Software Engineering

• Maker movement

• Emergent Technology

• Mobile development

• Internet of Things (IoT) and Wearables

• Big Data, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics

• BioTech

• FinTech

• User Interface Design & Information Architecture

• Marketing and Business Networking

• Social Entrepreneurialism

• Civic Engagement and Gov’t Policy

• Workforce Diversity

• Education & Technology (EdTech, 21st Ed)

• Capitalization and Fundraising (VC, angels, crowdfunding)


All meetup discussions will be supplemented with time for hands-on learning workshops. This is a group formed exists to support the startup community .

• Presentations

• Demo Nights

• Hackathons

• Coworking

• Startup Weekends

• Networks

• Show and Tell


Necessary Stakeholders in the EcoSystem - If this is you, come on out:

• Coworking spots

• Developers

• Entrepreneurs

• Designers

• Capital Community

• Educational professionals

• Government leaders


To be clear, we're looking to collaborate with the many other MeetUps in the area and welcome interaction so don't overlap too much and conflict. If you're organizing another MeetUp in this domain, this is another venue for you to network and present your ideas – we welcome the collaboration and conversation with kindred spirits.
results.name: NJ Strategic Design + Tech

results.description:
SAY HELLO TO YOUR NEW FRIENDS.

Our mission is to bring adventure and fun into your life while building lifelong friendships. As Eleanor Roosevelt once said, “the purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” And, that’s exactly what Welcome to Queens is all about! We are a fun group of young professionals with varied interests who are looking to get out, foster new friendships, and enjoy life.

We are a group of young professionals 21-39 looking to explore Queens.

Are you tired of sitting at home? Is it hard to get together with friends who are married or have moved away? Is the weekly bar scene getting boring and old to you? Well you are not alone! Modern day society has caused people to feel completely frazzled and out of sync with nature and enjoying what life has to offer. Get ready to dust off that bucket list and start living life to the fullest!

We pride ourselves in creating and organizing exciting and unique experiences. Have you ever thought what it might be like to be a trapeze circus performer? What about the exciting pastime of exploring wild caves – Spelunking? Or maybe, you’re into some indoor fun such as Dodgeball, Laser Tag, and Slam Dunk Basketball.

Our activities include everything from dinner and drinks and fun nightlife activities, to ski and camping weekend getaways, and everything in between. Do you want to ignite your summer with sky diving, parasailing, fun BBQ’s, and participating in sports activities such as Volleyball and Kickball? Do you have life goals such as running in a Spartan or Survival race? If you are looking to get off of the couch, meet new people, and have a blast, then Welcome to Queens is the group for you.
results.name: Queens/Nassau Adventure Seekers

results.description:
A Billion Entrepreneurs Foundation, Inc. presents: New York Business Meetup Workshop Series

The workshops are based on the successful Business Finishing School curriculum that focuses on the 12 Foundation Principles of Business.

Business Finishing School (“BFS”) is a leading business-growth education company that teaches “next-level” business principles; which are beyond the usual marketing, accounting, and management concepts.

Are you operating at your best inside your business?

Is the business you own (or work for) fully on purpose and hitting all of its objectives?

BFS believes that all businesses should sit firmly on top of the 12 Foundational Principles of Business, in order to maximize potential and growth. BFS has created a blueprint that virtually any motivated entrepreneur, executive, or employee can implement. This blueprint will add systemization and predictability to your growth and profit. By adopting these 12 principles, your organization will increase the probability of long-term success, while leveraging the talents and experience of all involved.

The Business Finishing School team will walk through the steps of a better framework for business and personal success; using an approach which builds on purpose-driven behavior. These events can be used to refocus your business or to plan a new venture the right way from the start. These meetups are a great way to learn about other local resources for entrepreneurs and connect with others who share the same passion for success.
results.name: New York Business Meetup

results.description:
Hello ladies,


We would like to thank everyone who have participated and still want to be apart of our group. Vanessa and I will no longer be able to accept new members as we are closing the group for now do to our current personal life obligations and when we are able to be fully committed we may reopen the group. Our Blog , Twitter and Instagram will still be available. Please check out updates there. Thank you for your understanding.


Warm regards,


Megan & Vanessa














This Group is for Woman who suffer from Mood Disorders ages 21+ only.

VERY IMPORTANT: We have a limit of 50 members in our group. Once we've reached 50, the remaining women will be placed on a waitlist, and will be on it until a spot opens up. Because of this, we urge our members to participate as much as possible, because if not, your simply taking up a membership spot from those women on the waitlist. 

What we are About: Our group is to reach out to woman in the New York area who suffer from Mood Disorders "diagnosed or not" for support and friendship. This group will bond woman of ages 21+ who can relate and understand one another through the voices of honest experiences-past and present as well as develop new long term friendships with exciting group activities.

Please visit our facebook page: <br>Www.facebook.com/strongwomenwithmd

Visit our blog page: <br>Strongwomenwithmd.wordpress.com

Visit our Twitter page: <br>Strong Women with MD

Visit our Instagram: <br>STRONG_WOMEN_W_MD

Our email is: <br>Strongwomenwithmd@gmail.com

Our Goal:  To help women just like us with mood disorders... Have you ever had a day where you could not get out of bed, a day where you lied to get out of a date that was planned, a night/week you could not sleep, a day where you could not eat or ate too much, a day you could not pay your bills, a day you realized you were the reason for losing your jobs, a day where no one understood you, a day you felt all alone, or even a day where you felt as if you wanted to die? That STOPS NOW!

Our hope for this group is to be there for one another through these times with support and no judgement. Our group is to build bonds with honesty that will lead to communication, trust and hopefully long term friendships that will result in fun activities.

This group will have bi-weekly meet ups for group discussion about our lives and at the end of each meet up we all will decide what we want our end of the month (or more) activity to be.

Group Commitment: This group will require you to be 100% honest in commitment to yourself and all of us when joining. We will ask you to read, post and share in our blog which will help inspire yourself and others. This blog will be about us, gratification and our success in friendship.  

strongwomenwithmd.wordpress.com 

RSVP & Attendee Policy: You should be able to attend at least one event per month. Anyone who has not attended an event within the first few months of joining will be removed. as the goal is to be an active member. If you RSVP yes, please do not cancel the day of the event. If you need to cancel, please do so within 48 hours of the event. No shows will not be tolerated and can lead to removal from the group. Changing your RSVP on the day of the event without notifiction is just as bad as not showing up. We take the time to make reservations and hold spot for you. Please keep the event host informed. 

Please understand and thank you.

Please keep in mind we are not licensed doctors or therapists. We are just like you. This group consists of woman sharing their stories and are here to listen and support only.

We look forward to meeting you,

Megan and Vanessa

A STRONG WOMAN is one who feels deeply and loves fiercely. Her tears flow just as abundantly as her laughter. A STRONG WOMAN is both soft and powerful. She is both practical and spiritual. A STRONG WOMAN in her essence is a GIFT to the world!
results.name: Friendship & Support Group For Women With Mood Disorders

Our panel format generally includes three people from the following types of industries:

 You’ll be at home in this group if you are:

results.description:
We Race Because… 
•One in eight women in the U.S. will be diagnosed with breast cancer in her lifetime. 
•Because every minute, somewhere in the world, someone dies from breast cancer. 
•And because, breast cancer knows no boundaries- be it age, gender, socio-economic status or geographic location. 
•We continue to Race because at the current rate, 13 million breast cancer deaths around the world will occur in the next 25 years. 

But, when you participate and fundraise for the Race, we fight these statistics together. In 1980, the 5-year relative survival rate for women diagnosed with early stage breast cancer (cancer confined to the breast) was about 74 percent. Today, that number is 99 percent! Komen has played a critical role in every major advance in the fight against breast cancer - transforming how the world talks about and treats this disease and helping to turn millions of breast cancer patients into breast cancer survivors. This progress was made with your continued support and together we can reach our vision of a world without breast cancer.
results.name: Susan G. Komen North Jersey Race For the Cure Meetups

results.description:
"Food is more than survival. With it we make friends, court lovers, and count our blessings." - Nat Geo 

This group is intended to bring together food lovers primarily in their 20s and early 30s. The goal is to make new friends, enjoy delicious food, and learn about different cultures. If you have a particular cuisine or restaurant you would like to try, feel free to let us know. We are always looking for cultural ambassadors who can show us their foods. 

DETAILS: We will have both small and large group dinners. 

• Small group (4-6 people) 

• Large group (6-12 people) 

In addition to dinners, to keep things interesting, we will host other events: 

• Coffee/Tea Meetups

• Food Crawls (sampling of food from different restaurants that are within walking distance) 

• Happy Hours/Bar Meetups 

• Karaoke 

• Sports 

• Picnics 

• Comedy Clubs 

• Shows 

• Game Night

RULES: 

1) FEES: We don’t believe in charging people to make friends. However, we also know that inconsiderate RSVPs spoil the experience for everyone. For most events we will charge a $1 maintenance fee, this is not to make money.  The money goes toward the group and covers the monthly website fee.  

2) ATTENDANCE: Most events will be first come first serve. If you RSVP and cannot go, please provide notice a day in advance. Of course, we understand there are emergencies, but please do let us know. 

3) RSVP policy: If you RSVP and cancel the day before the meetup, please send the organizer(s) a message to notify them. If you RSVP and do not show up on occasion depending on the circumstances you may be either suspended from the group for a longer period of time, or removed from the group. Though this may sound harsh, please understand that the organizers put time and effort into planning these meetups. More importantly, this gives others a chance to attend our events. 

4) Profile pictures: Please have a clear photo of yourself when you join. We know you're not actually the NY skyline or a cartoon character.  :)

Thank you and we look forward to meeting you all!
